fact: Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the world's highest peak.
Japan has more than 6,800 islands, with four main islands making up 97% of its land area.
Brazil is the only country in South America where Portuguese is the official language.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system.
China has the world's largest population and the Great Wall of China, which is over 13,000 miles long.
Egypt is home to the oldest known pyramid, the Pyramid of Djoser, built around 2630 BC.
Iceland has no mosquitoes due to its cold climate and volcanic activity.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, covering more than 11 time zones.
South Korea has the fastest internet speeds in the world and is a leader in technology innovation.
